author: jason.carver
content: <@543900561460822016> how do you feel about repurposing https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7639 to match https://hackmd.io/Dobc38YVQ1qmbbyI6LcFqA ? I can make a PR to update it if you like

author: lightclient
content: are there other changes beyond saying only bodies and reciepts will be dropped pre-merge?

author: pipermerriam
content: Yes, Setting May 1st, 2025 as the date that clients no longer need to respond to queries for bodies/receipts

author: lightclient
content: may 1st wouldn't go in the EIP, we would just say separately that we will activate the EIP by then

author: pipermerriam
content: Got it, then no, should just be to specify that it is only bodes/receipts that the EIP applies to

author: lightclient
content: but honestly I don't think that is a great activation mechanism, because many people only update their clients for hard forks. so i think it would be a lot better to say with pectra we will activate the EIP

author: pipermerriam
content: I don't have a strong opinion on the exact activation mechanics.

author: timbeiko
content: We'll hopefully be shipping Pectra before May --- is there a way to align the dates here?

author: lightclient
content:
i think clients need to serve both the new wire protocol not server history as well as the current wire protocol. you get good adoption of this and then you can start making client releases where they actually don't serve history at all and they can finally prune.

if you jump straight to starting clients by default not having history, you will have a bootstrapping issue because there will be very few nodes who actually update immediately for the new release
